Articles.Content: Does this have FAR compatibility?

Could we get a 3.75m -> 2.5m versions of the TP-205a and TP-105a? Tried re-scaling them myself but 2.5m -> 1.25m doesn't have the same proportions, a simple change in scale doesn't give you correctly sized ends.

Could we get a 3.75m -> 2.5m versions of the TP-205a and TP-105a? Tried re-scaling them myself but 2.5m -> 1.25m doesn't have the same proportions, a simple change in scale doesn't give you correctly sized ends.

It should do...

No since 2.5/1.25 = 2 and 3.75/2.5 = 1.5, a 3.75m version of the part would need to have the ends be a bit closer in size, if that makes sense, try it and you'll see.

.24 adds "3m" parts (I assume 3.75, it fits with the 0.65->1.25->2.5 system and mods like KW already uses 3.75m) thus having a 3.75m version of these parts would be appreciated, not only for us KW users but for stock in .24 as well.
Can I make a request for a Y joint? easy enough to do, modify the L joint with another attachment node (at least I think it would be easy, I don't know how to code at all.)

I went through my mods recently and trimmed them down - unfortunately, this was one that went. Building a Jool probe today, I suddenly needed a triangle structural plate, so back in went your mod. Still loving it

But yes, this is certainly a contender for the next KSPX. Awesome stuff!
Update News ?
I would remove the "breakingForce" and "breakingTorque" from the Tank-Caps, Nose-Cones don't have them either.

Update News ?

It's a parts pack, highly doubt any of it is affected in the last by .23.5

It's a parts pack, highly doubt any of it is affected in the last by .23.5

That was posted 26th March, it doesn't refer to compatibility, more like 'what update plans for the future, if any, do you have for this mod and if you do, how are they going?'

Update News ?

Too busy at the moment to even play KSP :I
would love to see more monopropellant tanks for this mod
How about a larger radial decoupler for 3.75m stacks.
Hey TurboNisu, could you make a 0.625m adapter for your lightweight truss? Like the stock Modular Girder Adapter, only smaller (in case you're not busy anymore).
This set of part is very good, and they really looks like stock parts. Great job TurboNisu, hope you'll find some time to work on it again.

This set of parts is great. One thing I feel is missing, though: a 45 degree truss segment (Like the L bend, except 45 degrees)! Sometimes, right-angles just look stupid.

Edited May 10, 2014 by loppnessmonsta
This mod needs some more love I always include it on every install I have!

Those dome parts of yours are wonderful! I'm a fan of attaching radial engines to my landers, and they work great to top off my fuel tanks. They will definitely come in useful to my later craft. Plus, the girder segments work well when the normal-sized girder is too heavy, and the cubic girder is too small. This really is a good mod that fills in little gaps that the stock parts have, and I agree that it needs more attention.
Glad this got bumped, and sorry I missed it before. These are some great parts. Downloaded!
This is f'ing boss. What do you plan on building in the future?
I love this! It's awesome!

Another hearty thumbs-up for this beautiful (and useful!) set of parts! =>

Shame they don't seem to be appearing over on Curse... [HINT, HINT]
The licence does allow you to redistribute, so if you wanted to put it up on curse you could.

The licence does allow you to redistribute, so if you wanted to put it up on curse you could.

Unfortunately Curse would pull it down because of authorship (based on similar prior cases), so perhaps something like MEGA, Dropbox, Google file share or Mediafire until TurboNisu uploads to Curse themselves?

Shame they don't seem to be appearing over on Curse... [HINT, HINT]
Unfortunately Curse would pull it down because of authorship (based on similar prior cases), so perhaps something like MEGA, Dropbox, Google file share or Mediafire until TurboNisu uploads to Curse themselves?

Why do you need them on Curse? There's a working download link (Mediafire) in the OP.

Look, I'll even quote it here for you:

Download: https://www./?et4ctfdh592a6sn

Also, as long as the license is sound (it is), Curse would have no right to take it down.
